properties.name: warmupdicator.show-details
properties.description: Show detailed information in health endpoint.

properties.name: warmupdicator.dto-warmer.exclude-patterns
properties.description: DTO class patterns to exclude from warmup. Supports wildcards like "*Record" or "*Immutable".

properties.name: warmupdicator.dto-warmer.warmup-serialization
properties.description: Warm up Jackson serialization by calling objectMapper.writeValueAsBytes(dtoInstance).

properties.name: warmupdicator.dto-warmer.warmup-deserialization
properties.description: Warm up Jackson deserialization. Feasibility is determined by: 1. For records: Uses Jackson's canDeserialize() capability check 2. For non-records: Requires successful DTO instantiation and serialization first. Default: true (failsafe handling prevents startup failures)

properties.name: warmupdicator.endpoint-warmer.endpoints
properties.description: List of HTTP endpoint warmup targets.

properties.name: warmupdicator.endpoint-warmer.endpoints[].name
properties.description: Unique identifier for this endpoint. If not provided, will be generated automatically.

properties.name: warmupdicator.endpoint-warmer.endpoints[].http-method
properties.description: HTTP method to use (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, HEAD, PATCH, OPTIONS).

properties.name: warmupdicator.endpoint-warmer.endpoints[].max-response-time
properties.description: Maximum acceptable response time threshold in milliseconds. Also used as HTTP request timeout.

properties.name: warmupdicator.endpoint-warmer.endpoints[].expected-status
properties.description: Expected HTTP status code (accepts any 2xx if not set).

properties.name: warmupdicator.endpoint-warmer.endpoints[].ignore-failure
properties.description: If true, failures will be ignored and the endpoint will be considered successful.

values.description: Unique identifier for this endpoint. If not provided, will be generated automatically.

If true, failures will be ignored and the endpoint will be considered successful.
DTO class patterns to exclude from warmup. Supports wildcards like "*Record" or "*Immutable".
Warm up Jackson serialization by calling objectMapper.writeValueAsBytes(dtoInstance).

Warm up Jackson deserialization. Feasibility is determined by: 1. For records: Uses Jackson's canDeserialize() capability check 2. For non-records: Requires successful DTO instantiation and serialization first. Default: true (failsafe handling prevents startup failures)
